Title: The Tao is Older than God ｜ Tao Te Ching Explained ｜ Chapter 4

Content.Knowledge Point: The Tao is an empty vessel that transcends all things.
Content.Text: The Tao is an empty vessel. It is used but never filled. Oh, unfathomable source of ten thousand things. Blunt the sharpness, untangle the knot, soften the glare, merge with dust.

Content.Knowledge Point: The Tao is the forefather of the gods and exists beyond time and space.
Content.Text: Oh hidden deep but ever present. I do not know from whence it comes. It is the forefather of the gods.

Content.Knowledge Point: The Tao is part of the universal law that governs all reality.
Content.Text: The Tao Te Ching sets up the Tao as part of this universal law. Part of the framework upon which all known reality is built.

Content.Knowledge Point: The Tao's teachings can coexist with religious beliefs.
Content.Text: In my opinion, this means a religious person need not shy away from the teachings of the Tao at all, as they are not mutually exclusive.
